alert.note: Alert for East Honolulu; Ewa Plain; Honolulu Metro; Kauai East; Kauai North; Kauai South; Kauai Southwest; Koolau Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Waianae Coast (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued October 31 at 3:20PM HST until November 01 at 8:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...MINOR COASTAL FLOODING DURING HIGH TIDE THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... .High astronomical tides combined with above normal water levels will likely continue to produce minor flooding along shorelines and vulnerable low lying coastal areas around the time of high tide early Wednesday morning for Kauai, Niihau, and Oahu. Elevated water levels could linger on Kauai and Niihau during the morning high tide cycles through the end of the work week. Elsewhere, the peak high tides and elevated water levels are expected to trend down and no longer pose a flooding threat. ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Isolated minor coastal flooding. * WHERE...Vulnerable low-lying coastal roadways, docks, boat ramps, marina parking lots, and other coastal infrastructure of Kauai, Niihau, and Oahu. * WHEN...Around the time of the Wednesday morning high tide, with peak high tide occurring between 4 AM and 630 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of beaches that are normally dry, minor coastal erosion, and saltwater inundation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Submit your coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org
info.instruction: Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Move electronics, vehicles or other valuables to higher ground. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and watch out for overwash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches.
